parameters.content:
🚀 Google Drive Trigger (Starting Point)

What it does:
Acts as the "sensor" that watches for new files
Monitors a specific Google Drive folder called "Instagram"
Checks every minute for newly created files
When a new file is detected, it grabs all the file information (ID, creation time, file extension, etc.)

Technical Details:

Folder ID:(your Instagram folder)
Polling: Every minute
Event: Only triggers on "fileCreated" (not file updates or deletions)
Output: Passes file metadata to the next node

Real-world example: When you upload "photo.jpg" to your Instagram folder, this trigger activates and sends the file details forward.

📝 Set Formatted Name (Processing)

What it does:
Takes the original file's creation timestamp
Converts it into a standardized filename format
Creates a new filename following the pattern: IMG_YYYYMMDD_HHMM.extension

Step-by-step process:

Extract Date: Takes createdTime like "2024-12-25T14:30:45.123Z"
Format Date: Converts "2024-12-25" → "20241225" (removes hyphens)
Extract Time: Takes "14:30" → "1430" (removes colons)
Combine: Creates "IMG_20241225_1430.jpg"
Preserve ID: Keeps the original file ID for the rename operation

Example transformation:

Original: "vacation_photo.jpg" (created on Dec 25, 2024 at 2:30 PM)
New name: "IMG_20241225_1430.jpg"

✏️ Rename File (Final Action)
What it does:

Takes the formatted filename from the previous step
Uses Google Drive API to actually rename the file
Updates the file in Google Drive with the new timestamp-based name

Technical process:

Uses the file ID to locate the exact file in Google Drive
Sends an update request to Google Drive API
Changes the filename to the formatted version
Maintains all other file properties (content, permissions, etc.)

Authentication: Requires Google Drive OAuth2 credentials to access and modify files.

_metadata.name: Automatic File Renaming with Timestamp Format for Google Drive
